name: AICCELERATE Pediatric Palliative Care Procedures
description: List of some important procedures used within pediatric palliative care

concept.display: Drainage of Stomach with Drainage Device, Via Natural or Artificial Opening Endoscopic (Nasogastric feeding tube)
Respiratory Ventilation, Less than 24 Consecutive Hours
Respiratory Ventilation, Greater than 96 Consecutive Hours
Introduction of Other Gas into Respiratory Tract, Via Natural or Artificial Opening (Chronic Oxygenotherapy)
Bypass Trachea to Cutaneous with Tracheostomy Device, Open Approach
Bypass Trachea to Cutaneous with Tracheostomy Device, Percutaneous Approach
Bypass Trachea to Cutaneous with Tracheostomy Device, Percutaneous Endoscopic
Restriction of upper esophagus, percutaneous endoscopic approach
Restriction of middle esophagus, percutaneous approach
Restriction of esophagus, percutaneous endoscopic approach
Bypass Stomach to Cutaneous with Synthetic Substitute, Percutaneous Endoscopic Approach
Insertion of Feeding Device into Stomach, Open Approach
Insertion of infusion pump into abdomen subcutaneous tissue and fascia, open approach
Insertion of infusion device into spinal canal, percutaneous approach
